website_summaries.verdict: High performance, versatile wireless machine that prints, copies, scans, and faxes.
pros: Easily caters the job to your needs
Print remotely from smartphone or tablet
Syncs with Google Drive and other office programs
Features double-sided print, copy, and scan option
cons: Ink cartridges can be pricey and require frequent purchase

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful printer with a range of capabilities that comes at a reasonable price.
pros: This mid-priced compact printer delivers copying, faxing, and scanning
The Smart Tasks scan function can create searchable documents
cons: The printer may stop in the middle of large jobs

customer_reviews.title: New printer doesn’t work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived, spent an afternoon trying to set it up. Doesn’t recognize its own print cartridges, no help on HPs website, support services. Sending the $230 dollar boat anchor back to the geniuses who designed it. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY - WHO NEEDS THE AGGRAVATION?
customer_reviews.author: Mel Rose

customer_reviews.title: All I Can Say is "WOW"
customer_reviews.text: Set up and printing in less than 15 minutes, which isn't bad for a non-tech 71 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot print
customer_reviews.text: I set up the printer as I was instructed. After downloading all updates I could find; and installing all print cartridges the printer tells me that the cartridges are not connecting. when I click on the ink levels, they show that they are empty. What now?
customer_reviews.author: William Cagle

customer_reviews.title: No Way
customer_reviews.text: It's been a disaster from the beginning. The printer has had a series of issues (printhead missing or incorrectly installed, cartridge problem), the software is buggy and had a hard time finding the printer, etc. The net result is that after 90 minutes I still haven't gotten through the on-screen menu.
customer_reviews.author: Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even deserve 1 star rating
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased an HP OfficeJet Pro 9025 all-in-one. Printer came with a one page written instruction manual. Printer cartridges don't stay in cartridge slots. Can't even find a serial number and worse yet, no support on website. I'm ready to put this back in the box and return it. Now I remember why I swore I would never buy another HP product. Exercise in futility.
customer_reviews.author: Silkgirl12

customer_reviews.title: Has trouble installing and printing through a firewall
customer_reviews.text: My firewall (Bitdefender) blocks the printer from installing and actually printing. Strangely, I have 8 other printers installed (I use this at work also), including several HPs, and they all work fine through the firewall. Not this one. If I switch to the windows firewall, it works. Strange that they don't either 1) test to see that the printer works through a firewall (like their other printers do); and/or 2) don't actually alert you to this (none of the error messages mentioned a potential firewall problem) and provide a workaround.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Kossik

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: A know printer error "output bin full" gives an error message and prevents multiple documents printing at once. Each printed document has to be removed from the tray before the next one prints. There are documented stories of this issue on Google. It is not as good a product as the previous 8020 series.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McKeefery

customer_reviews.title: You need to get your own ink
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived and I was wondering why it was not printing. Well it turns out that the ink cartridge was all dried up had to go and buy a new one just to try the printer out. Was very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Dried up

customer_reviews.title: wasted 5 hrs trying to install and had to return
customer_reviews.text: neither HP on line robot support or live telephonic help could get this running. two error messages once software installed. "can't find server" and "paper return tray is full" (approx error messages) despite successful software installation and no paper in output tray at all . because i could never get this to print. scanning appeared to work. HP support did not have a 9025 on hand to diagnose any of these problems which were either glitchy software at the printer machine level or a faulty detector. I'll see how I do with a replacement 9025 and if i have a problem with that I'll look for a older more established and less buggy model
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Logan

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION Mac OS Catalina users
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I can save someone some time. Scanning does not work to Mac OS Catalina via either of HP's apps. Even Apple's Image Capture doesn't work reliably due to some connection mystery. What does seem to work reliably is going in through System Preferences, selecting Printers & Scanners, selecting the HP OfficeJet 9010 Pro Series printer (as a PRINTER––you won't see it listed as a scanner), then clicking on the Scan tab. It works well. (Of course it took me several hours to figure this all out.)
customer_reviews.author: R. Wellmore

customer_reviews.title: Check from day one to see if it will scan to pdf format.
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box the paper kept jamming from the first time I used it. In addition it was not programmed to scan items to computer file in pdf format, only jpeg and related photo formats. Spent 2 hours on the phone with HP-IT to get it programmed. Then I returned it due to not being able to fix the jamming problem
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Roach

customer_reviews.title: Fair deal sorta.
customer_reviews.text: Good printer bit had to call them and customer support had to control my computer to get printer to work. So in my opinion installation IS NOT USER FRIENDLY. Dont buy the ink deal it's not worth it. Picture printing is only fair at best. Copies good and fast.
customer_reviews.author: raymond guy larsen

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work - couldn’t get set up
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this printer. I’m an avid HP customer and this printer offered everything I was looking for to upgrade my older printer. Unfortunately this one didn’t deliver. Spent over 2 hours trying to set up (unsuccessfully). Kept getting error messages about print head and ink cartridges leaking. Followed all instruction and downloaded new software with no luck. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Defective output tray sensor renders printer virtually worthless
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!! Print quality is excellent, however it has a fatal flaw - there is an output sensor that is overly sensitive. It reads that the "output tray is full" after every time it prints two pages. This stops the printing immediately and prohibits further printing. Forget remote printing ever if you are not physically present to clear the output tray. Even if you push in the output tray and let the print job fall to the floor, the output tray sensor still stops the function even when there is nothing in it. In researching the problem it was revealed this is a common problem. Only had the printer since yesterday. Need to figure out how to return it
customer_reviews.author: Anna Owen

customer_reviews.title: DOn't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: New printer purchase less than a month ago and it's terrible, I can't print back to back and have the pages lined up properly. I just went to print a page and its got another paper jam. Page finally prints up and it's not completely centered the way it should. I guess I'm being picky expecting the pages to print right. In the pictures, you can see where it is outlined in red that it is not lined up. I did a realignment of the machine.... It didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, cheaply made and terrible touch screen
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my officejet pro 8620. By comparison sounds like a piece of plastic junk. It has a slower response to wake up, and it's noisy. The touch screen nearly impossible to manage because it is over sensitive. NOTE: There is a setting to make the 9015 quieter, but it sacrifices print quality, and the start up cheap printer sound remains. I called HP to discuss my product experience. I tried to get them to swap at no extra charge to the 9025 but they wouldn't. I could have returned it to Amazon and was hoping they accommodate a repeat HP printer user...but they would not budge. They sent me ink. So I remain disappointed with my new HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: ashowstopper

customer_reviews.title: flimsy substitute for the 8600
customer_reviews.text: The print tray is so flimsy and so poorly angled that paper jams constantly, and, when printing, spews out from the tray, which has only a 6" extension and an upward curve, into the room. To print documents or receive faxes of more than a single page, it's useless. It is nothing like the 8600 model it replaced. Don't be fooled.
customer_reviews.author: hiram

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer for Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Cannon imageClass laser with this printer. Prints reliably via WiFi and is very fast for everyday use. Only a few days in, but VERY happy with purchase. Driver install was straightforward. I use both Mac and Win10 and got everything up and running in just over an hour, including setup on 4 computers. I also liked the fact I could set defaults to economical printing. That took a little more savvy, but it worked great out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: flintrockco

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRINTER IS "THE BEST"
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the "BEST", took about 5 minutes to set up without tech support, forget the less expensive printers that give you"ERROR MESSAGES" and cause you United issues and time. Well worth the$$$$$! Printed from all devices the first time and every time. This product will pay for itself in time saving and is well worth the extra money HP always makes excellent printers. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: died in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: printer died. got a replacement under amazon return window. then the replacement died out of amazon warranty. the replacement arrived in june. died in september. out of warranty now. do not ever buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to the HP 8610
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, semi fast and a good comparable to the HP 8610. I was hesitant to purchase this with all the bad reviews, but took a chance and so far so good. It's not quite as fast as I thought it should be, but the print quality is there as well as the ease to hook up to a mac environment. I would recommend for a small office.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Not to my liking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my 8610 that I had for 3.5 years. I didn't realize at the time of purchase that it isn't capab;e of doing legal size documents. While I don't use that size often, I don't want to scramble or go to the UPS store to make something that size. I wasn't pleased with the size of the touchscreen. It is a good product, just not suitable for me
customer_reviews.author: Sybilla Turner

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it.  Scanning doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and I read them lightly considering many negative reviews are due to operator error, but some reviews say the feeder tray jams and it does. The top feeder tray wasn't able to feed several documents attempted and ended up wrinkling them all. I had to contact tech support (which was very helpful) to get the Scan to Computer function to work. That took almost an hour to fix. The software comes with a "Smart" task feature that I still have no idea what it does. Since I use a printer mostly for scanning, I had to return this. So many scanning issues with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Best printer yet
customer_reviews.text: My previous Samsung printed on two sides but I had to put the paper back in the printer in order to have two sided copies. My HP prints on both sides without that bother. This one is wireless, which I love and it can copy and scan. It's smaller than the Samsung and has more capability. It's also quiet and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Stephannie

customer_reviews.title: Fast Wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a vast improvement over my last HP all-in-one. The wireless feature works with ease, from my wife's laptop and from my phone. It has a much smaller footprint than the previous printer. Still don't know how to fax from the program on my desktop rather than from the small screen on the machine itself. A learning curve for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M

customer_reviews.title: Great SOHO printer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying this printer given the other reviews, but it works great with my iMac. Setup was very easy, and the print quality and speed are phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert King

customer_reviews.title: Few blows with a sledge hammer might help.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely HATE this printer! I had an 8600 officejet for years and I loved it. This printer in no way compares to it. The print itself is horrible, forget printing photos on it. You can only print "letter" sized paper on it and forget printing an envelope. The final straw was today when this horrible piece of you know what decided to eat an envelope and won't throw the darn thing back up. Somehow it managed to jam it so far up inside it's nether regions that short of taking a sledge hammer to the whole useless hunk of plastic there is no way it will ever work again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OfficeJet refined
customer_reviews.text: I have used HP OfficeJets for years. Switched to a Brother and it broke down within a year. This HP 9025 has resolved all the issues of previous products. Excellent job by HP to produce a great office/home printer. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Sampadian

customer_reviews.title: So far. I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: Much faster at printing and scanning than I thought it would be. Up and printing in less than 10 minutes. I saw reviews about not keeping the cartridges in but I think of the ease of toggle motion for them, some people with shaky hands might have an issue. My tech level is high.
customer_reviews.author: Knght4Amor

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: past 30 days so can't get Amazon replacement. Called HP and they give you the typical run around. Spent hours on phone trying to explain the bin full error message and they still can't figure out that this printer is basically just worthless. Slow print when it decides it's finally going to print something which is rare. HP didn't even offer to send out a tech they just wanted to send me a new output bin tray. No thanks, ill eat the $$ spent on this and go buy something other than an HP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving it.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased that printer was as described and measured precisely to fit in location. The larger digital control is a great convenience. Very pleased with the prints and the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: WVMama

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade???
customer_reviews.text: Well HP calls this model an upgrade. With that comes a much smaller antiquated touch screen. It is almost impossible to touch the little icons across the top. The plastic housing on this model is thinner and cheaper made than the previous two generations, which I have owned. So all that is disappointing. You also have to take a bunch of extra steps to opt out of the auto data collection that is the default when installing the printer. Also annoying. For HP this printer is not really an upgrade. It seems to print and scan okay. I guess we will see about the longevity of the device and
customer_reviews.author: Honest

customer_reviews.title: Tray 2 of printer is inferior.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HP 9025 that I had to return. Both printers have issues with tray 2. The first printer would jam then began not picking up the paper in tray two. The second printer jammed from the first time that I used Tray 2. I needed to print an envelope and it jammed. I got it out tried a second envelope ad it jammed. Then I tried a sheet of paper and it jammed and you could not get the whole sheet out without it tearing in the machine. The other features of the printer are great and the printing is so clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of free ink not included!
customer_reviews.text: The printer is ok, has the functions needed (scanner, print, copy). Print quality is ok, could be a little sharper, but satisfactory for home use for school or work needs. The biggest issue is, it was advertised as having a 2 year subscription for ink included, yet no instant ink promo code was included, so buyer beware. They will scam you on that, and Amazon will not guarantee it, even though it originally was listed as being covered by the A-Z guarantee. Best advice is look for a printer elsewhere and not get ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: do not purchase this printer
customer_reviews.text: My older model of HP lasted 5 years but worked better than the new one. I purchased the upgraded model thinking that it would have more functions than the 5 year old one and it is worse. I cannot even believe that I used HP again when the old printer broke in just 5 years. Everything was fine until that broke. :DO NOT purchase this printer! it does not configure correctly with all devices, it cannot save to a shared drive like it states. I have spent hours with Tech support at hP and they cannot even understand why. It is a complete was of money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous installation difficulties.
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the "easy setup" stories. HP provides very sparse, undetailed and nonspecific installation instructions in print and via their website.. At start-up, for first time use, the ink cartridge carrier was frozen far right instead of automatically centering. After a long wait, I connected to tech support. With help from the HP tech, we devoted 2+ frustrating hours to install and connect the printer to my Windows 10 PC through on-board Bluetooth. Competitive printers are available that approach "plug and play" without problems. Suggest: Canon or Brother. Avoid HP.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Xeen

customer_reviews.title: HP will remotely Shut Down your ability to print if you cancel their monthly subscription
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for business use in a marina where there is not a stable internet connection. We enrolled in the instant ink service, but because our internet connection was unstable the printer would not allow us to print until we connected to the internet. Our only option was to cancel the instant ink service to continue using the printer. When we cancelled the service they shut down the ink cartridges and we were still not able to print. We were forced to pay additional fees and to go buy additional "non-instant ink" cartridges for $200 just to use the printer. Would not recommend to my enemies. Please do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joweenie

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, slow and it freezes up at least once a week. A 60 page print job that took 5 minutes on my previous printer took this one over an hour to print. Had our IT company re-work my settings and troubleshoot and it is no better now. Still can't get it to print or scan from my computer - have to use the touch screen (which is tiny and hard to read) every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Giant Headache
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a headache since buying it. The scanning software is incredibly glitchy, its wireless feature was so hit-or-miss that I just hooked it up to wired LAN, and then in less than a few months, the printer head had a problem requiring replacement parts. Tech support was willing to help (as it was under warranty), but ended up sending the wrong part. It took an additional week to get the correct one, which was a major inconvenience for my business as we had to obtain a backup printer just to handle day-to-day tasks. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Careful who you buy from
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is great. The people I bought it from on Amazon not so much. They will false advertise and that the unit comes with 2 years worth of free ink and then give you a coupon in the box where HP will not honor the coupon since the coupon is not for this region. All the company can offer me is to send the unit back to them for a full refund. Yeah ok. That is not the solution. Beware is all I can tell you.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: Seems flimsy and noisy, does not give me confidence in quality
customer_reviews.text: We received our printer, and did the initial setup. When we went to set up "scan to email" it is not easy for a non-IT person. Our previous scanner (HP Officejet Pro 6830) was so quick and effortless. We still don't have the scanner setup. Printing was easy, copies are working and we like the amount of paper it holds. When the device is printing, it is quite noisy and does not sound well built or sturdy. The touchscreen is small but works. We hope the device stands up to a small office (3 employees) environment.
customer_reviews.author: Kids

customer_reviews.title: Passed the 'Mom' Test
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me then you're playing the role of IT for your family. I purchased this for my mother to replace her previous printer which didn't have a working scan function. 9 months in and I haven't received a single tech support call from my mother. Setup was fairly straightforward and I did encounter one issue with the surge protector I was using, but other than that the printer has been performing as expected. If you're like me and you have family members that aren't technically inclined - this printer was simple enough for my mom to figure out which is a big plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Ink is a fortune
customer_reviews.text: What HP doesn't tell you is that in the Office Jet Pro 9015 and others you can't just print in black ink and then when its empty just replace the black cartridge. When you run out of any other color then you have to replace that color, blue, magenta or yellow before the printer will be able to print again - even just in black. Hell of a way to make you buy colors that you don't use. HP says it is to lubricate the print heads. However, I almost never use the non-black colors but they deplete anyway. So, figure that cartridge replacement will run about $100 for XL cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this printer. Good quality. Good value. Easy to set up. All my computers and phones print wirelessly to it over my home network. It has 2 paper trays. I keep plain paper in one and business checks in the other. The only downside is that the scanner bed is smaller than my old one. This only comes into play when I'm scanning lots of photos at the same time. I just can't scan as many at once as I used to. Also, can't scan large stuff. When scanning multiple items at once, it will recognize each item as a separate item automatically.
customer_reviews.author: GlennMS

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: First, the listing and printer both state this is a 9015, however, all configuration paperwork and printer setup confirmation papers state 9010. I was able to print about 12 pages before the printer status changed to No Paper, even though there was paper in the printer. I rebooted the printer and ran a diagnostic, was able to print two additional pages. Rebooted the printer and ran another diagnostic, to no avail. Returning it; piece of caca. My $80 printer works much better, i just got tired of buying ink. I would NOT recommend this item to my enemy.
customer_reviews.author: YvieB

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This printer is garbage for color printing. If you're only printing in black and white, it's fine, but if that's the case, don't spend this much on a printer. I didn't find out until too late that apparently most HP printers print too dark. And it's not just a shade or two. It's pastel coral printing as crayola red. I've researched a lot into it and the settings that most printers have to fix this are not available on HP. This printer is too expensive to be useless at color printing, and I found out outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for?
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully it wasn't too expensive. I can print from my phone or laptop via wifi...sometimes(?) Its kinda tricky, but to be honest I havent had time to call tech support....I'll just print from work. I've sent print jobs through email, shipping labels come out huge! But again, I'm sure I'm doing something wrong. Its smaller in size, which is nice. I loved our old HP printer, which is why I tried this one. This one prints rough.....like it's broken, but not. Our old printer was smooth as can be. I MISS OUR OLD PRINTER!
customer_reviews.author: HisLilLady09

customer_reviews.title: Quality is alright but Unfriendly user interface.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of materials used in this printer seem typical. The user interface assumes that one is very familiar with using printers. We were not and find ourselves having to hunt up "how tos" on the internet. Once we figure out how to do something we are happy with the results so far. We have had it about a month.
customer_reviews.author: York Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Sometime HP don't get it right
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of HP products for over 20 years and I have some very large printers of theirs as well as some desktop models but I have to say that now and again they get it wrong and this printer is a dog. The print quality is poor the software is poor and the whole thing is just not up to standard. I have had to re-install this thing over 6 times so far, it works for a few days then just stops seeing the printer if I could send it back I would but that ship has sailed. A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shore

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy paper trays and generally cheaply made, i.e. are not sutable for office use. This is advertised as a replacement for the HP Office Jet Pro 8600 Plus but it is a very poor substitute. Flimsy construction, loss of features and a general disappointment. I would not recommend purchase of this junk. There are many more options out there that are well made with more features. The instant ink idea is a money maker for HP and not a plus for a purchaser to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Prints pictures OK
customer_reviews.text: I almost did not buy this printer because of all the negative info on printing pictures. However in needed the speed more than the pictures. Figured I would buy a separate printer for pictures if this one was not satisfactory. I have had it running only four days and to my surprise it prints pictures just fine. Perhaps the others had different software. My only reason for a 4 star instead of 5 is just that I have not used it but four days and have not thoroughly tested all features.
customer_reviews.author: Bow Bender

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRINTER!
customer_reviews.text: I love this all in one office jet! It was super easy to install, easy to use and the print quality is excellent! I still can't get over how fast it prints! I love the fact that it connects through WiFi, no cords needed! It connected to my WiFi effortlessly and it stays connected. One of my favorite features is the HP Instant ink. It's very inexpensive and I will never run out of ink! The new cartridges get delivered right to my door and are a fraction of the price compared to buying them in a store!
customer_reviews.author: Frank K.

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, works great from start.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried with some of the reviews. But just received the product and it took me less than 15 minutes to set up. Printer works great and was able to add it to my home network and print from multiple devices. It does tell you that there's a jam at first, but that's because you need to load the paper into tray. Once you do that, there are no problems and everything goes smoothly. I like the feature to scan from both sides as well.
customer_reviews.author: happygolky

customer_reviews.title: Low quality from a software and mechanics point of view - will cite examples
customer_reviews.text: I have IT background and bought this for a small office. I've found HP product to be generally good, but this printer is an exception. Print quality is mediocre -- visibly not as good as laser. Mechanics seem cheap. For example, every second time we get "output tray" full after just 3-4 pages have printed. It isn't full, and the it triggers inconsistently. Software conflicts with application level settings at times. It has been painful to own this printer -- many small issues. I've had much better luck with HPs laser printers.
customer_reviews.author: AZ76737

customer_reviews.title: Quality & Function
customer_reviews.text: It is clear that HP is the only game in town when it comes to inkjet. I had the previous ‘All-In-One’ and was satisfied with the quality of its performance. This model is a completely different story. The printer is very cheaply made. The setup to get the scans sent to the computer was horrible. The work-around online is a circuitous, labyrinth of BS. Tech Support is absent. To top it off, after I resolved all other problems myself, I received an error message “Your printer is low on ink” after printing FIVE PAGES of normal black/white. omg! I hate this printer and the HP ink being crammed down my throat every day. I wish there was another option.
customer_reviews.author: TrishInHouston

customer_reviews.title: Scanning???
customer_reviews.text: Update: Downloaded HP Scan and that seems to work ok so far. Not as easy as other HP printers that I’ve had that didn’t need a separate app but at least it seems to get the job done so far. I just hooked up the 9025 which was easy enough. Everything seems fine but scanning is strange. At least on a mac. My last two HP printers had simple easy scanning methods. Not sure I'm going to be able to figure out the EWS/IP Address/ Blah blah blah on this thing. Why make something like this complicated?
customer_reviews.author: T Lex

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jams Often
customer_reviews.text: I keep getting paper jams OFTEN. The print quality is good tho when it does work. I don't know why I get jams so much. I had an older model before and it never jammed up like this. Most of the time when it says it is jammed the paper is fine and not what I would consider and actual jam.
customer_reviews.author: Brinkbabe9`

customer_reviews.title: Did not work?
customer_reviews.text: What a joke, so I bought this printer because an older model was having issues. I had kept in storage for two month before needing it. Took out of box and it would never get me pass installing cartridges and test print page. Contacted amazon chat help and ended up for over an hour and 30 minutes with no issues resolved. Finally ended up call them. They tried to sell me an extended warranty on chat and I had already purchased an extended warranty. End up calling Asurion, they had connected me with Canada HP , I live in USA. End up on hold with HP, for now 20 minutes. Could someone just help me this is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: CowsRabbitsDogs

customer_reviews.title: good machine
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a hp all in one I used for years. This one was small enough to fit in a tight spot. I am surprised so far at the quality of its copy/print. All the all in one features work well. And I am surprised so far at the instant ink Value. Never thought that would be the value it is. If it holds up will be a stellar performer here.
customer_reviews.author: Taka

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated for me
customer_reviews.text: It is a wonderful printer I am sure but I do not have enough skill to use it properly. It is supposed to dance and sing but I cannot turn on the record. The online help is not helpful to me. I have not been able to reach a person and the recorded help is nearly useless if I don't know what they are referring to. The problem is with me and not the printer. This printer is not for the novice.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Works well, holds alot of paper, good color, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought an Epson( 7700 not sure ) with the large ink tanks, the quality of everything was terrible and slow for this $400. machine. Amazon took it back. I chose this HP, I have used it for about two weeks, works like it should, for alot less money.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Harold Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Duplex print does not allign
customer_reviews.text: I print a lot of duplex (double sided) pages for checklists and other items that have to be trimmed. It is therefore important that the both side align well. Never an issue with the Office Jet Pro 8625 this should have replaced, but 1/4 of an inch misalignment with this printer. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sven

customer_reviews.title: NO CARTRIDGES
customer_reviews.text: Warning!!!!! Description states that this comes with initial cartridges. Even the printer, during set up, says it came with cartridges. It does not! When you call into customer service to let them know that you did not get your cartridges, they will tell you that they do not come cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer. BUT stops if any ink cartridge in low
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and setup. However there is a lot of software that HP pushes. I like the smaller size than the previous HP printer; some may find it is still large for a home office. UPDATE: Does not operate if one of the ink cartridges is empty. This means if the yellow cartridge is low and the black cartridge is full that it will not print simple documents that do not use color. This is a miserable marketing tool for an otherwise great printer.
customer_reviews.author: MAH

customer_reviews.title: Please Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing you a favor if you pass on this machine. I'm a tech wiz and this machine had not one but three different problems. Paper feeder fed crooked or jammed. Machine makes noises that make it sound broken. Had to reset several times because HP software setup doesn't interact properly. Overall, very poor quality for high price, don't understand how gets four stars. Simple internet search reveals people with same problems.
customer_reviews.author: Design Center

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen is very small. Otherwise the printer works very fast and the copies are excellent. Ink was easy to install Two paper trays are handy, but the slide out shelf for the printed pages is not ideal. It took a long time to install. I did not use tech support. I also requested that the printer should be shipped inside an Amazon box as I live in an apartment building. It was shipped in only the printer box and left in my lobby, not inside my mailbox as indicated (no way it could have fit anyway). I was home and no one rang the doorbell. Luckily, I "found" the box in my lobby/hallway, intact.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleGirl2016

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and document feeder is horrible
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years of buying good HP printers, this is the worst one ever. It is very loud and the document feeder screeches and barely gets two pages through without jamming. It also has a clunky touch screen that requires three touches at least to make a copy of a one page document. It is horrible. Do not buy this printer. The feeder is just about useless.
customer_reviews.author: mgmm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up!  Has all key features!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous about purchasing this unit because of reviews that said it was hard to set up. We were very pleasantly surprised - it took my husband, who is not a techie - less than half an hour to fully set up and have running on his two laptops. They offer two options to set up. The automatic set-up through a computer did not work, so he used the alternative that they suggested and that worked very easily. All I had to do was connect and download the drivers automatically and we were both up and running. Printing wirelessly works very well. Great features - scanning, copying, 2-sided printing. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: wallaby

customer_reviews.title: EH!  not a quality printer
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old HP 8500 series - so I opted for the updated/upgrade. This one worked fine out of the box (unlike other reviewers) however the touch screen is not user friendly. It has a second paper tray that is no use; you can not select it from the print screen. When printing more than 1 page (which is kinda the point) the error message says "the output tray has reached it maximum". so you have to remove each page as it is printed, try to make 100 copies of anything and you are stuck "babysitting" this printer. Not a quality in a good printer !!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer, never experienced this disaster of a printer.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new printer has many problems, did not recognize the set up ink cartridges, after many tries, no help from technical support after 40 minutes hold time. Didn’t have a clue, wanted me to put the ink cartridges in the wrong color spots. HP is just floating on their old reputation and producing junk. Send it back the next day after receiving. Went with another brand with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent print quality - easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive all-in-one color printer, this one is a top notch buy. Set up was easy: no fiddling around to link the printer to my home network. It's accomplished automatically. The print quality is excellent and it compares quite favorably to a laser printer I use on occasion. As a bonus, the iPhone app to control the printer from a smart phone works flawlessly. - I haven't needed tech support, so no comment there. But as it stands now, after a few weeks of hard use, I would definitely recommend this printer to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: LWD

customer_reviews.title: Mostly is functional
customer_reviews.text: An All in One printer that for the most part works fine but it does NOT scan to computer (mac of any OS version). You can scan to a multitude of locations but NOT to a directory on your own hard drive directly (only if you have a separate cloud drive, or setup network shares). A vital function of scanning missing means that you have to control the scanning from a computer which means lots of walking back and forth, instead of being able to scan and control from the printer to a computer on a network. For an "Office" printer in its title, this misses out on an essential function and unacceptable from an office point of view.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: HP 9025 printer thumbs down!
customer_reviews.text: Worst HP printer ever. Touch screen is very small and hard to operate with your finger. I purchased it new, only to have to it replaced with a week. They sent another one. Tech support took 2-3 to get this one to work. For small off, HP 8600 was the best. This HP 9025 is supposed to be much better. Don’t think so!! Only thing it’s got going better than it’s predecessor is that it scans both side in one pass, this I can live without. Very dissatisfied with this “new and better” HP printer. Hello Brother’s!
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: What an annoyance !!!!  DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: HP ink cartridges are not stable and after waiting weeks for a new HP Office jet pro 9020 the cartridges would not satisfy the printer and the display just wouldn't allow set up to proceed. There is no one to contact to ask, request new cartridges or to seek any reasonable solution. The result is a re-packaging of a new printer, getting UPS to make another trip to my house where I get to wait for them and an hour of thinking I'm the problem and I wasn't. Then the replacement would have taken over a month to arrive with no guarantee the same problem wouldn't exist again. Good bye HP I'm done!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Green

customer_reviews.title: BEST ONE YET
customer_reviews.text: I just received the printer and thus far it is the best one I've owned. The setup was easy. Very fast printing. We will see how it handles in the future.
customer_reviews.author: INTERNATIONAL MUSIC SYNDICATE

customer_reviews.title: False Description - Does NOT include 2 year ink supply code
customer_reviews.text: Buy this elsewhere! I received the white printer. Not the metal finish and did not get the 2 year ink supply as stated all over this item. Printer is fine and replaced an old one that the printer head went out but totally disappointed that I didn’t get exactly what I ordered!
customer_reviews.author: marshomwiggle

customer_reviews.title: The Office Jet Pro 9015 is a very good value.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this when it arrived because the body is of a lesser weight than its predecessor, so I was afraid it might not perform as well. But it has worked out very well. It was easy to set up (I am a technical nincompoop, but I managed to get it set up on my own.) It responds quickly to print requests, the print is evenly dark, the paper is simple to replace and the instruction plate on the front is simple to use and understand.
customer_reviews.author: laureln

customer_reviews.title: Will not print heavier photo papers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated! Will print normal photos but not heavier stock. Feed path is too tight and heavier stock hangs. I had a 1 star but changed it since it will print photos. Prior HP did print the heavier card stock so not really an upgrade except for the app. I set up the printer and everything seemed fine. It printed regular documents great but as soon as I tried printing business cards on heavy double sided photo paper it jammed. Every single time from either tray. If you want to print business cards or anything on heavy photo paper DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER!
customer_reviews.author: John O. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Not a  printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Printer is OK once you get it going setting it up is not easy took about 2 hours
customer_reviews.author: trekex8

customer_reviews.title: Scanner is good
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is a little weak. I still have hp 8620 and it has a better clarity of print. 9025 also is very noisy. It was very easy to install and set up. The scanner works well. It will do double sided scans. So I use both printers with this being generic prints and scanner use.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to replace my old hp 8600 ink jet pro. I installed this in under 25mins. Me and my wife love the fact that you can scan something from your phone and have the option of printing it or emailing it straight from our phone. Looks nice next to my computer. Prints pretty fast
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this OfficeJet Pro 9025 to replace an HP 8620 I'm giving to daughter, and this 9025 is working great, right out of the box! Very easy to set up, although I preferred using the “professional” setup instead of HP Smart. Everything works! Ink cartridges are good, scanning to PDF or JPG works fine, scanning to computer works fine, printing is fast.... It does everything I want, so I’m happy. While waiting for this printer to be delivered, I noticed a lot of negative reviews about the printer... I did not experience any of those issues. Maybe those folks don’t know how to set up a printer? As usual, this HP product is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ABQ Geek

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer for Small Business or Home Office
customer_reviews.text: Nice double sided scanning capability. Reliability is good so far. Fast printing. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Wcc

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and value!
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I have ever owned. Super easy to set up, pairs well with my phone, and an incredibly easy to use app. The double-side scan is such a great feature, and the print quality is excellent. Paper jams are a breeze to take care of, and the touchscreen is very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Simran and Sachin

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of negative reviews about this printer and severals like it. I have had issues with previous printers dropping the signal and subsequently being unable to be found by the computer until it’s turned off and restarted, or deleted and reinstalled. I have had no issues with that from this printer yet. We even had a brown-out and a hurricane and it still stayed connected. So far it has handled all jobs I’ve needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan vasaturo

customer_reviews.title: Great printer- Rotten freight carrier
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. I am upset about the quality of delivery. The box was delivered without notifying us. It was left on a front bench, which after delivery was rained upon, badly. The outer carton disintegrated from the downpour, but luckily, HP completely covered their printer in a plastic bag, preventing damage from the thoughtless delivery person. This is no fault of Amazon or Hewlett Packard, just the delivery people. Until I saw there was no damage, I was outraged.
customer_reviews.author: Shellman25

customer_reviews.title: Cannot disable power off
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this printer on WiFI only the options for automatic power-off are up to 8 hours. No doubt it's an effort to save the planet, but it is absolutely infuriating. If you have the printer in your home, and do not print a document at least every 8 hours, you won't be able to print a document at will. Instead, you first need to schlep it over to the printer, hit the button, wait for it to turn back on, warm up, and do all it's gyrations before you can print. When it's on and working it's a great printer though.
customer_reviews.author: mummy rabbit

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good..........until
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars, not that it doesn't print well, but that you have to have the internet and download the installation software from the Microsoft Store.. You also have to download the manual. Setup has been very trying. However, now the printer does seem to work well. Since I only received this printer yesterday, there Will be an updated review. Update 10/20/2020 If I could return it, I would. Oh, it printed great for a month. Then I had to call tech 5 times in the next month. And each tech contradicted the prior! It still dloes not work right! Well, when the warranty runs out and it breaks down, I'm getting a NON HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace my old OfficeJet, and I'm extremely disappointed. The print quality is okay, but more times than not, it doesn't communicate properly with my computer. (In simple terms, when I tell my computer to print something, it doesn't print--but I also don't receive any type of an error message. Then, sometimes the document will randomly print a day or two later.) Additionally, it will periodically tell me it's out of paper--when both trays are filled. In short, the printer has been nothing but a headache. I wish I'd bought it from a store with a more flexible return policy.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherCustomer

customer_reviews.title: HP has got it right with this one
customer_reviews.text: I had a good experience using HP printers in the past but switched to other brands in between and had a terrible experience with those brands. I am back to using HP again and I really like the seamless experience this printer provides, right from setup to printing. The app is easy to use and the print quality is good. I wish the the feeder on top would automatically turn the page over when scanning both sides, instead of us having to do it manually. I also wish the printer or app would allow the combination of the front and back page into a single PDF file, instead of creating two files.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is just OK
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an HP 8710 OfficeJet Pro with this printer. My only reason was because I thought the 9020 would handle heavy weight paper better. I was wrong. I don't see any difference and the 9020 tends to pull through multiple pieces of paper. It even sounds "tinny" compared to the 8710 and is slower. This was a big waste of money for me. Loved the 8710, definitely should have stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: ShoeboxsMom

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy - These are REFURBISHED units
customer_reviews.text: Not disclosed anywhere is that these units are refurbished. (At least the one delivered to me was refurbished). The warranty is only 90 days, and the warranty is through National Warranty Service and not HP. The description says that the warranty is 1 year. THIS IS FRAUD. DO NOT BUY. Returning mine and the ink I purchased through Amazon right away. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: dont buy cant even download the drivers for this peice of crap and they cant help you.
customer_reviews.text: don't buy cant even download the drivers for this peice of crap and they cant help you.
customer_reviews.author: cliff hughes

customer_reviews.title: The paper tray jams constantly
customer_reviews.text: When this prints it is great. However...The printer tray does not lock into place for 8.5 x 11 paper. In printing an envelope, it will also not lock into place. You also must change the paper size on the touch screen, and then find where to change it back. The number of paper jams in just one week are too numerous to count. HP has fixed things like the paper size which in previous models were automatic and therefore, not broken. If these issues continue I will have no choice but to drop this from the highest window I can find. Very very disappointed in HP.
customer_reviews.author: Jcollier

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: What a great printer. I love that I can print from my phone from anywhere. Great print quality, easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Z.

customer_reviews.title: Scans crooked every time
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second printer now. BOTH original and replacement scan crooked on the automatic document feeder. I spoke with the Indian? technical help and they verified the crooked scanning. Replacement still scans crooked in the auto feeder!! I also dislike the automatic ink replacement since my printing needs vary. I dislike that companies are locking us in to subscription based software and supplies. Print quality acceptable, but this is not like my HP 6700 the had no problems ever.
customer_reviews.author: John Shane

customer_reviews.title: Well-built, reliable workhorse printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this OfficeJet Pro 9015 printer to replace an Epson printer that had died. One of the reasons why I chose it is because of the HP Instant Ink program, which is a phenomenal way to pay for printer ink while ensuring that you always have enough ink for a project. I've used the printer to print, copy and scan documents; I haven't used the fax feature---and I'm very satisfied with it's performance, speed, reliability and accuracy. So far, no complaints whatsoever... so I heartily recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Allie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent inkjet printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HP OfficeJet Pro 9015 after considering some of the ink tank options. After reading reviews, these other printers sound like the quality and reliability weren't up to par, so went with this printer which offered the traditional cartridges but with a 50% cost saving of HP Instant Ink program. I signed up for the entry level version of 50 pages per month at $2.99/month and will see how that works over time. So far the printer is great, was easy to set up, and the wireless prin options are fantastic. I wish the color scheme was a solid, dark gray like our last HP but will willing to look past cosmetics for the right printer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Years Ahead of its time !
customer_reviews.text: Just got my 9025 last week... First... Very well packed.. Bought it from Amazon, Great price ! Does a LOT (double sided printing, scanning, Copying etc...) Very ....super nice design Definitely a WORKHORSE and you can tell it isn't cheaply made either. Prints very fast. Also Just signed up for the Insta-ink (comes with 4 months free !) and The ink cartridges.... have a LOT of ink in them ! Lastly... printer is quiet, Love the self healing Wifi, Keeps my printer always connected.
customer_reviews.author: Transam99

customer_reviews.title: Great duplex features, annoying paper tray.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this thing is wireless and the duplex (2 sided) scanning is great for saving or sending documents. So far we haven’t spent more on ink than with the previous printer, so no complaints. Only complaint is no dedicated paper tray for different sizes, so if you want to print to smaller paper (photo paper or envelopes), you have to take out your printer paper, put in the smaller paper, print, then put your printer paper back in. But so far the convenience of duplex scanning, copying, and printing at this price point and with the relatively compact size is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K.

product_meta.title: HP OfficeJet Pro 9015 All-in-One Wireless Printer, with Smart Home Office Productivity, HP Instant Ink or Amazon Dash replenishment ready (1KR42A)
product_meta.description: Model:9015 - standard| Style:PrinterUpgrade your productivity?the HP OfficeJet Pro 9015 All-in-One is a revolutionary inkjet printer that works to meet your needs. Features like Smart Tasks and the scanbed's easy slide off glass help increase productivity and save time. Reduce interruptions and maintain privacy and control, thanks to the 9015's self-healing Wi-Fi and best-in-class security. No matter how you choose to connect to your wireless printer, you can be confident in quality prints.MINIMUM SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS FOR WINDOWS/MACINTOSH- WINDOWS 10,8, 7: 1 GHz 32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) processor, 2 GB available hard disk space, CD-ROM/DVD drive or Internet connection, USB port, Internet Explorer and OS X V10.11 EL CAPITAN; MACOS SIERRA V10.12 (PREVIOUSLY OS X); MACOS HIGH SIERRA V10.13; 1.5 GB available space; Internet access; USB
feature_bullets: Upgrade your office – Replacing the OfficeJet Pro 8710, this small office printer offers faster printing at 22 pages per minute, automatic 2-sided copy and scan, a 35-page automatic document feeder, and is 37% smaller

Genuine HP 962 ink delivered to your home: get your first 2 months free when you enroll in HP Instant Ink (optional) during printer set up; plans starting at $2.99 per month after the trial period, shipping and recycling included
Print remotely using HP Smart app: Access your printer and scanner, monitor ink levels, and print, copy, and scan on the go with our highly-rated HP Smart app
Self-healing Wi-fi: Ensures you stay connected by detecting issues and automatically undergoing up to 3 stages of reconnection to keep your Wi-Fi stable and reliable
Built-in security essentials: Protect sensitive data with built-in security essentials like basic encryption, password protection, Wi-Fi security, and document protection
Create editable, searchable documents – Use Smart Tasks in the HP Smart app to scan documents to cloud software like iCloud or Box that you can later search and edit before printing
One-year limited hardware warranty – Get help with 24-hour, 7 days a week FREE HP Web support. Easily set up your printer by downloading the HP Smart app on your mobile device
Sustainable design – This multifunction printer features a sustainable design made with up to 10% recycled plastic

Organize documents 50% faster – Eliminate steps in repetitive tasks and sync to QuickBooks, Google Drive, and more using Smart Tasks—the easiest way to digitize and organize receipts and business documents on your phone or printer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,094 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
